title: Earl Klugh - Earl Klugh - 1976 - FLAC
description:
Earl Klugh is the debut album of Earl Klugh released in 1976.  It  
features Louis Johnson on bass and guest appearances of Lee  
Ritenour on electric guitar.  The album peaked at number 124 on the  
Billboard 200 chart and reached number 16 on the Jazz chart.

A variety of musicians and composers were involved in the recording  
and production of the album including some backing music provided by  
the Los Angeles Philharmonic Orchestra.  The album was produced by  
Dave Gruisin and Larry Rosen and engineered by Phil (Boogie)  
Schier.  Recording sessions were conducted during January and  
February of 1976 at Kendun Recorders in Burback, California.  Earl  
dedicated the album to his mother and brother in the liner notes.

Earl Klugh was an early protÃƒÂ©gÃƒÂ© of George Benson and has also  
played for such industry stalwarts as Chick Corea and Stanley Clarke  
prior to the recording of this eponymous album.  The lineup of songs  
include covers of Neil Sedaka's "Laughter In The Rain" as well as  
some original work such as "Angelina", "Vonetta", and "Wind and  
Sea".  The opening song of the album "LasManos De Fuego" displays  
the virtuosity of Earl's playing style as his fingers nimbly attack almost  
every portion of the guitar fret board at a frantic pace.  This album  firmly 
established Earl Klugh as a dynamic player and composer and  was the 
impetus of a very long career as an innovative jazz guitarist during the 
establishment of the early smooth jazz fusion era.
